page.title: 12Memories of Gotherington
page.content: The Evergreens are a group of O.A.P's. who get together in Gotherington Village Hall once a fortnight.This is what one of them recalls about the village in recent times. 'Gotherington in the early 20th century had a population of 350.It was a poor straggly village but had a good name for paying its way.All adults took out insurance policies to pay for funeral expenses.The railway which ran through the village wasn't used by the villagers because the station was too far away. There was a Carrier who came by cart from Gretton Fields who would deliver things to Cheltenham.A bus service started at the end of the 2nd World War.At the time of the Coronation of the present Queen there was a grand Fete.There was lots to eat which was a treat as we were still getting over rationing.'
